SEARCH
Package com.example.ClassDiagram

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
Controller class for managing the logic and operations related to the Class Diagram in the UML Editor.

This class handles all the logical functionality associated with the Class Diagram, including the management of UML model components such as classes, interfaces, and their relationships (e.g., associations, inheritances). It serves as a bridge between the UI and the business logic layers.

Responsibilities of this class include:

  • Creating and updating UML components in the class diagram.
  • Validating relationships and constraints, such as inheritance.
  • Saving and loading class diagram data as part of a project.
  • Supporting code generation based on the class diagram model.

Constraints:

  • Implements relevant design patterns for maintainability and scalability.
  • Handles exceptions related to model integrity and persistence.

    Represents a connection (e.g., line) between two class diagrams.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller by setting up the canvas, event listeners, and UI components.

      Tasks include:

      • Setting up the canvas for UML diagram creation and editing.
      • Configuring zoom, resizing, and keyboard shortcuts (e.g., DELETE key).
      • Attaching actions for buttons to create and manage UML components.
      • Enabling mouse interactions for dragging, editing, and adding components.

    • loadUseCaseDiagram

      public void loadUseCaseDiagram()
      Handles loading of the use-case diagram by switching scenes. Prompts the user to confirm if unsaved changes will be lost.

    • loadClassDiagram

      public void loadClassDiagram()
      Handles loading of the class diagram by switching scenes. Prompts the user to confirm if unsaved changes will be lost.

    • updateClassHierarchy

      public void updateClassHierarchy()
      Updates the class hierarchy view in the TreeView component.

      This method clears the existing hierarchy and repopulates it with the latest UML diagram information. It includes attributes and operations of each class or interface.

    • createItalicLabel

      public javafx.scene.control.Label createItalicLabel(String text)
      Creates a styled Label with italic text.
      Parameters:
      text - the text to display in the label
      Returns:
      a Label with italicized text style

    • createInterfaceDiagram

      public void createInterfaceDiagram(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double x, double y)
      Creates a new Interface Diagram at the specified coordinates. If a diagram at the location doesn't already exist, it is created, drawn, and added to the hierarchy.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext for drawing the diagram
      x - the x-coordinate for the diagram
      y - the y-coordinate for the diagram

    • updateUIForSelection

      public void updateUIForSelection()
      Updates the UI to reflect the current selection. Disables or enables the "Add Attribute" button based on the selected component type. Updates the button's style and tooltip accordingly.

    • handleSelectionChange

      public void handleSelectionChange()
      Handles changes to the selected component, updating the UI and redrawing the canvas.

    • drawInterfaceDiagram

      public void drawInterfaceDiagram(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.InterfaceDiagram interfaceDiagram)
      Draws an Interface Diagram at its specified location with a rectangle, labels, and operations. Highlights the diagram if selected and draws connection points.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for drawing
      interfaceDiagram - the InterfaceDiagram to draw

    • getMaxTextWidth

      public double getMaxTextWidth(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.InterfaceDiagram interfaceDiagram)
      Calculates the maximum text width for a diagram's labels and operations.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext for measuring text
      interfaceDiagram - the InterfaceDiagram whose text widths are calculated
      Returns:
      the maximum text width

    • resetSelection

      public void resetSelection()
      Resets the current selection, clearing any highlights or tool states. Restores the UI to its default state and redraws the canvas.

    • handleZoom

      public void handleZoom(javafx.scene.input.ScrollEvent event)
      Handles zooming on the canvas using the ScrollEvent with the Control key held down. Adjusts the scaling factors to zoom in or out, constraining the zoom to reasonable limits. Redraws the canvas with the updated scale and redraws all diagrams.
      Parameters:
      event - the ScrollEvent triggered by the user's scrolling action

    • handleCloseAction

      public void handleCloseAction()
      Handles the close action for the application. Displays a confirmation dialog to the user asking if they want to exit the application. If the user clicks "OK", the application is terminated. If the user cancels, the dialog is simply closed without taking further action.

    • clearSelection

      public void clearSelection()
      Clears the current selection of components and diagrams from the canvas. Resets the selected component and diagram key, then redraws the canvas to remove any highlighting or visual indicators of selection.

    • handleZoomKeys

      public void handleZoomKeys(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Handles zooming actions using the Control key along with the ADD and SUBTRACT keys. Zooms in or out on the canvas by adjusting the scaling factors when the user presses the Control key along with either the ADD (+) or SUBTRACT (-) key.
      Parameters:
      event - the KeyEvent triggered by the user's keyboard input

    • handleButtonClick

      public void handleButtonClick(javafx.scene.control.Button clickedButton, List<javafx.scene.control.Button> buttons)
      Handles the logic for clicking on a toolbar button. If the clicked button is already active, it deselects it. Otherwise, it deselects all buttons in the provided list and selects the clicked button, updating its visual state with CSS classes.
      Parameters:
      clickedButton - the button that was clicked
      buttons - a list of all toolbar buttons for deselection

    • deselectAllButtons

      public void deselectAllButtons(List<javafx.scene.control.Button> buttons)
      Deselects all buttons in the toolbox. This method removes the "tool-button-selected" style class from all buttons in the provided list and ensures the default "tool-button" style class is applied. It also clears the current active button.
      Parameters:
      buttons - the list of toolbox buttons to deselect

    • drawGrid

      public void drawGrid(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Draws a grid on the canvas by using the provided GraphicsContext. The grid lines are spaced every 10 pixels and have a light gray color.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext of the canvas where the grid is drawn

    • createClassDiagram

      public void createClassDiagram(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double x, double y)
      Creates and stores a new class diagram at the specified position (x, y). If a class diagram does not already exist at this position, it creates one, stores it in the `diagrams` map, draws it on the canvas, and updates the class hierarchy.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext of the canvas for rendering the diagram
      x - the x-coordinate where the class diagram should be placed
      y - the y-coordinate where the class diagram should be placed

    • drawClassDiagram

      public void drawClassDiagram(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram classDiagram)
      Draws a class diagram on the provided GraphicsContext.

      This method renders the class diagram with a rectangle containing the class name, attributes, and operations. It also displays connection points for diagram connections. If the diagram is selected, it is highlighted with a specific border and background.

      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for drawing
      classDiagram - the Controller.ClassDiagram to be drawn, containing coordinates, dimensions, and content

    • getMaxTextWidth

      public double getMaxTextWidth(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram classDiagram)
      Calculates the maximum text width required for the given class diagram's contents.

      This method iterates through the class name, attributes, and operations to determine the widest text, ensuring sufficient space for rendering the class diagram.

      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for text measurement
      classDiagram - the Controller.ClassDiagram whose text content is analyzed
      Returns:
      the maximum width of the text in the class diagram

    • selectDiagram

      public void selectDiagram(double mouseX, double mouseY)
      Selects a class diagram based on mouse coordinates.

      This method determines whether the mouse click falls within any class diagram's bounding box. If a diagram is selected, its key and reference are stored, and the UI is updated accordingly.

      Parameters:
      mouseX - the X-coordinate of the mouse click
      mouseY - the Y-coordinate of the mouse click

    • isEmptyArea

      public boolean isEmptyArea(double mouseX, double mouseY)
      Checks if a given mouse position corresponds to an empty area on the canvas.

      This method verifies if the mouse coordinates are outside the bounds of all class diagrams and are not near any line or its control points. It is useful for determining whether user interactions, such as adding new diagrams, can occur at the specified location.

      Parameters:
      mouseX - the X-coordinate of the mouse position
      mouseY - the Y-coordinate of the mouse position
      Returns:
      true if the mouse position is in an empty area, false otherwise

    • onMousePressed

      public void onMousePressed(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles mouse press events on the canvas.

      This method manages interactions based on the mouse click location and type (e.g., single click, double-click). It handles component selection, control point addition, line drawing, and interaction with specific UI elements.

      Parameters:
      event - the MouseEvent representing the mouse press action

    • deleteSelectedComponent

      public void deleteSelectedComponent()
      Deletes the currently selected component from the canvas.

      This method supports removing class diagrams and line connections. It updates the data structures to reflect the changes and redraws the canvas to ensure the UI is consistent.

    • onMouseDragged

      public void onMouseDragged(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles mouse drag events on the canvas.

      This method enables dragging of class diagrams, line control points, or lines themselves. If a new line is being drawn, it provides a visual preview. It ensures boundaries are respected and updates the canvas in real-time.

      Parameters:
      event - the MouseEvent representing the mouse drag action

    • handleClassEditing

      public void handleClassEditing(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Handles mouse click events for editing class diagram components.

      This method identifies which part of a class diagram is clicked (e.g., class name, attributes, or operations) and opens a text field for editing if a double-click is detected. It supports both Class and Interface diagrams.

      Parameters:
      event - the MouseEvent representing the mouse click
      gc - the GraphicsContext for redrawing the canvas

    • editAttribute

      public void editAttribute(com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram classDiagram, int index, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Allows editing of a specific attribute in a class diagram.

      A text field is displayed over the selected attribute for editing. Changes are committed when the user presses Enter or the text field loses focus. The canvas is redrawn to reflect the updated attribute.

      Parameters:
      classDiagram - the Controller.ClassDiagram containing the attribute to edit
      index - the index of the attribute in the list of attributes
      gc - the GraphicsContext for redrawing the canvas

    • editOperation

      public void editOperation(com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram classDiagram, int index, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Allows editing of a specific operation in a class diagram.

      A text field is displayed over the selected operation for editing. Changes are committed when the user presses Enter or the text field loses focus. The canvas is redrawn to reflect the updated operation.

      Parameters:
      classDiagram - the Controller.ClassDiagram containing the operation to edit
      index - the index of the operation in the list of operations
      gc - the GraphicsContext for redrawing the canvas

    • editClassName

      public void editClassName(com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram diagram, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Allows editing of a class or interface name in a diagram.

      A text field is displayed over the class or interface name for editing. Changes are committed when the user presses Enter or the text field loses focus. The canvas is redrawn to reflect the updated name, and the class hierarchy is updated if applicable.

      Parameters:
      diagram - the Controller.ClassDiagram or Controller.InterfaceDiagram whose name is being edited
      gc - the GraphicsContext for redrawing the canvas

    • getAccessModifierSymbol

      public String getAccessModifierSymbol(String accessModifier)
      Converts an access modifier into its corresponding UML symbol.
      Parameters:
      accessModifier - the access modifier as a string (e.g., "public", "private")
      Returns:
      the UML symbol for the access modifier ("+", "-", "#", or "~"), or an empty string if the access modifier is unrecognized

    • onMouseReleased

      public void onMouseReleased(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
      Handles the mouse release event when drawing a line between diagrams.

      This method checks if the mouse release occurred near a valid connection point on another diagram. If a valid connection is established, a line connection is created and the canvas is redrawn. Otherwise, an error message is shown.

      Parameters:
      event - the MouseEvent representing the mouse release action

    • getNearestConnectionIndex

      public int getNearestConnectionIndex(com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram diagram, double x, double y)
      Finds the nearest connection point on a diagram based on the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      diagram - the Controller.ClassDiagram to search for connection points
      x - the x-coordinate of the reference point
      y - the y-coordinate of the reference point
      Returns:
      the index of the nearest connection point, or -1 if no point is found

    • isInvalidLineConnection

      public boolean isInvalidLineConnection(com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram startDiagram, com.example.ClassDiagram.Controller.ClassDiagram endDiagram, javafx.scene.control.Button lineType)
      Validates the connection between two diagrams based on the selected line type.

      Disallows certain line types (association, aggregation, composition) between interface diagrams and other diagrams.

      Parameters:
      startDiagram - the starting Controller.ClassDiagram of the connection
      endDiagram - the ending Controller.ClassDiagram of the connection
      lineType - the Button representing the selected line type
      Returns:
      true if the connection is invalid, false otherwise

    • loadDiagramFromFile

      public void loadDiagramFromFile()
      Loads a saved diagram from a file and restores it to the canvas.

      This method uses object deserialization to retrieve diagrams and line connections, reinitializes necessary fields, and redraws the canvas.

    • saveDiagramToFile

      public void saveDiagramToFile()
      Saves the current diagram and its connections to a file.

      This method serializes the diagram data into a file with a ".diagram" extension.

    • showInfo

      public void showInfo(String message)
      Displays an informational message to the user in a dialog box.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to display

    • showError

      public void showError(String message)
      Displays an error message to the user in a dialog box.
      Parameters:
      message - the error message to display

    • redrawDiagrams

      public void redrawDiagrams(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Redraws all class diagrams on the canvas.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for drawing

    • exportAsJPEG

      public void exportAsJPEG()
      Exports the canvas content as a JPEG image file.

    • exportAsPNG

      public void exportAsPNG()
      Exports the canvas content as a PNG image file.

    • saveCanvasToFile

      public void saveCanvasToFile(String format)
      Saves the current canvas content as an image file in the specified format.

      This method captures the canvas as a snapshot, converts it to a BufferedImage, and saves it to a user-selected file. If the format is JPEG, it removes the alpha channel to ensure compatibility.

      Parameters:
      format - the file format to save the image in (e.g., "jpeg", "png")

    • convertToBufferedImage

      public BufferedImage convertToBufferedImage(javafx.scene.image.WritableImage writableImage)
      Converts a WritableImage to a BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      writableImage - the WritableImage to convert
      Returns:
      the resulting BufferedImage

    • removeAlphaChannel

      public BufferedImage removeAlphaChannel(BufferedImage originalImage)
      Removes the alpha channel from a BufferedImage, replacing it with a white background.
      Parameters:
      originalImage - the original BufferedImage with an alpha channel
      Returns:
      a new BufferedImage without an alpha channel

    • onAddAttribute

      public void onAddAttribute(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Adds a new attribute to the selected class diagram.

      The attribute is prefixed with the selected access modifier symbol and added to the diagram's attributes list. The canvas is redrawn to reflect the changes.

      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used to redraw the canvas

    • onAddOperation

      public void onAddOperation(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Adds a new operation to the selected class diagram.

      The operation is prefixed with the selected access modifier symbol and added to the diagram's operations list. The canvas is redrawn to reflect the changes.

      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used to redraw the canvas

    • redrawCanvas

      public void redrawCanvas(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Redraws the entire canvas, including the grid, diagrams, and line connections.

      This method clears the canvas and sequentially redraws the grid, class diagrams, and dynamic line connections with their respective styles and shapes.

      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for drawing

    • calculateTriangleBaseIntersection

      public double[] calculateTriangleBaseIntersection(double[] end, double[] start, double triangleSize)
      Calculates the intersection point of the base of a triangle with a given line segment.
      Parameters:
      end - the endpoint of the line segment as an array [x, y].
      start - the starting point of the line segment as an array [x, y].
      triangleSize - the size of the triangle base.
      Returns:
      an array [x, y] representing the intersection point.

    • calculateDiamondBaseIntersection

      public double[] calculateDiamondBaseIntersection(double[] end, double[] start, double diamondSize)
      Calculates the intersection point of the base of a diamond shape with a given line segment.
      Parameters:
      end - the endpoint of the line segment as an array [x, y].
      start - the starting point of the line segment as an array [x, y].
      diamondSize - the size of the diamond base.
      Returns:
      an array [x, y] representing the intersection point.

    • drawHollowTriangle

      public void drawHollowTriangle(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double endX, double endY, double startX, double startY, boolean isSelected)
      Draws a hollow triangle on the canvas with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for drawing.
      endX - the x-coordinate of the triangle's tip.
      endY - the y-coordinate of the triangle's tip.
      startX - the x-coordinate of the line's starting point.
      startY - the y-coordinate of the line's starting point.
      isSelected - whether the triangle is selected, affecting its appearance.

    • showLineTextField

      public void showLineTextField(double mouseX, double mouseY, Controller.LineConnection line, javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Displays a text field at the midpoint of a line, allowing the user to edit its label.
      Parameters:
      mouseX - the x-coordinate of the mouse position.
      mouseY - the y-coordinate of the mouse position.
      line - the LineConnection object to edit.
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for redrawing.

    • isNearLine

      public boolean isNearLine(double mouseX, double mouseY, Controller.LineConnection line)
      Checks if a given point (mouse position) is near any segment of a line.
      Parameters:
      mouseX - the x-coordinate of the mouse position.
      mouseY - the y-coordinate of the mouse position.
      line - the LineConnection object to check.
      Returns:
      true if the point is near the line; false otherwise.

    • pointToSegmentDistance

      public double pointToSegmentDistance(double px, double py, double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Calculates the shortest distance from a point to a line segment.
      Parameters:
      px - the x-coordinate of the point.
      py - the y-coordinate of the point.
      x1 - the x-coordinate of the starting point of the segment.
      y1 - the y-coordinate of the starting point of the segment.
      x2 - the x-coordinate of the endpoint of the segment.
      y2 - the y-coordinate of the endpoint of the segment.
      Returns:
      the shortest distance from the point to the segment.

    • drawDiamond

      public void drawDiamond(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc, double endX, double endY, double startX, double startY, boolean isSelected, boolean filled)
      Draws a diamond shape at the specified position with optional fill and highlighting.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext used for drawing.
      endX - the x-coordinate of the diamond's tip.
      endY - the y-coordinate of the diamond's tip.
      startX - the x-coordinate of the starting point of the line.
      startY - the y-coordinate of the starting point of the line.
      isSelected - whether the diamond is selected, affecting its appearance.
      filled - whether the diamond should be filled with color.

    • isNear

      public boolean isNear(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Determines whether two points are within a specified snapping tolerance.
      Parameters:
      x1 - the x-coordinate of the first point.
      y1 - the y-coordinate of the first point.
      x2 - the x-coordinate of the second point.
      y2 - the y-coordinate of the second point.
      Returns:
      true if the two points are within the snap radius; false otherwise.

    • initializeConnections

      public void initializeConnections()
      Initializes the buttons for each LineConnection in the diagram.

    • exportToJavaCode

      public void exportToJavaCode()
      Exports the UML diagrams as Java code files to a user-selected directory. Opens a directory chooser to select the export location and generates Java code for each class or interface in the UML diagram, saving them as .java files.

    • parseAccessModifier

      public String parseAccessModifier(String declaration)
      Parses an access modifier and declaration from a UML notation. For example, "+ name:Type" would return "public Type name".
      Parameters:
      declaration - the UML declaration string.
      Returns:
      the parsed Java declaration as a string.

    • parseAttribute

      public String parseAttribute(String attribute)
      Parses an attribute declaration in UML notation and converts it to Java syntax. For example, "+ attributeName:Type" would return "public Type attributeName".
      Parameters:
      attribute - the UML attribute declaration.
      Returns:
      the parsed Java attribute declaration as a string, or a comment if invalid.

    • parseOperation

      public String parseOperation(String operation)
      Parses an operation declaration in UML notation and converts it to a Java method signature. For example, "+ anyFunction(String id, String name):boolean" would return "public boolean anyFunction(String id, String name).
      Parameters:
      operation - the UML operation declaration.
      Returns:
      the parsed Java method implementation as a string, or a comment if the format is invalid.

    • parseInterfaceOperation

      public String parseInterfaceOperation(String operation)
      Parses an operation declaration in UML notation and converts it to a Java interface method signature. For example, "+ anyFunction(String id, String name):boolean" would return "boolean anyFunction(String id, String name);".
      Parameters:
      operation - the UML operation declaration.
      Returns:
      the parsed Java interface method signature as a string, or a comment if the format is invalid.
